newsitem.title: JORDAN: Israeli woman stabbed in Jordan, lightly wounded.
newsitem.headline: Israeli woman stabbed in Jordan, lightly wounded.

text.p: An Israeli woman was stabbed in northern Jordan by an "unbalanced man" on Wednesday but was only lightly wounded, officials said.
A doctor at the Yarmouk Health Centre near the city of Irbid said the 30-year-old woman was treated for a knife wound in the stomach but was released after less than an hour.
He said the incident took place near the popular tourist site of Umm Queis, an old Roman city overlooking the Sea of Galilee and the Golan Heights.
Umm Qeis is just a few km (miles) from the border area of Baqoura, leased to Israel under a 1994 peace treaty, where a Jordanian soldier shot dead seven Israeli schoolgirls in March.

Information Minister Samir Mutawae said the woman was attacked after she became separated from a group of Israeli tourists. After treatment she was well enough to enjoy an impromptu lunch with Jordan's Tourism Minister Aqel Beltaji, he said.
He said the attacker had been apprehended and would be charged.
"An unbalanced man tried to hurt her. I don't think he knew she was an Israeli," Mutawae told Reuters. "It was superficial (and) she continued her journey and had lunch with the minister of tourism."
